alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:38AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sheridan County through 415 AM MDT... At 338 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rushville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rushville, Clinton, Lone Butte, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 88 and 101. Highway 250 between mile markers 43 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
